Package View

Class KlotskiUI

java.lang.Object
View.KlotskiUI
public class KlotskiUI extends Object
Class that handle the interaction with View package (view facade)

  • Constructor Details

    • KlotskiUI

      public KlotskiUI()
      Create the frame and the mainPane, display the credit screen. Create but not show the Auth and Configuration panel

  • Method Details

    • initStart

      public void initStart()
      Display the configuration chooser and the Auth panel

    • initGame

      public void initGame(Rectangle[] position, int counter)
      Display Blocks and Buttons needed for the Game
      Parameters:
      position - Blocks positions
      counter - moves counter

    • restart

      public void restart(Rectangle[] initialPositions)
      Restart the UI to the specified positions
      Parameters:
      initialPositions - initial Blocks positions

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(Move lastMove, int counter)
      Make the specified move
      Parameters:
      counter - moves counter

    • selectBlock

      public void selectBlock(Component selected)
      Parameters:
      selected - Block desired to get selected

    • initUser

      public void initUser(String user)
      Display the player name, in the authentication pane
      Parameters:
      user - string with the username of the logged player

    • logout

      public void logout()

    • showSavedGames

      public void showSavedGames(Vector<String> savedGamesNames, MouseAdapter listener)
      Parameters:
      savedGamesNames - string representing the saved games of the logged user
      listener - that handle the click in the button with a saved game

    • askGameName

      public String askGameName()
      Input dialog asking the desired game name to save the match
      Returns:
      null if closed, or a string with the typed name

    • showMessage

      public void showMessage(String message, String title, int type)
      Parameters:
      message - Desired message to display
      title - title of the pop-up windows
      type - type of message to be displayed - ERROR_MESSAGE, INFORMATION_MESSAGE, WARNING_MESSAGE, QUESTION_MESSAGE, or PLAIN_MESSAGE (0-4)

    • showAuthenticationDialog

      public boolean showAuthenticationDialog()
      Returns:
      true if the user choose to Authenticate or false if not
